page.title: 01GRAYS,A GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: {GRAYS}is a town on the north bank of the River Thames.The riverside industry is in decline. The majority of the block shows a variety of housing from Victorian to present day. To the west there are old chalk quarries being used for an oil storage depot and to accommodate new housing estates. To the east there is farmland crossed by a newly built major road to the docks, and schools and colleges. {BLACKSHOTTS Sports facilities:-swimming pool,International running track, International cycle speedway track, football,cricket,rugby,bowls. {TOWN CENTRE Modern centre with further development anticipated {PEOPLE Large ethnic community,mainly Indian
